detailsOfAchievement: "Stage India Performing Arts and Research Centre" Stage India was officially created in 1998.Our mission is to create extraordinary theatre that inspires and entertain our audience and to provide outstanding theatre training and performances that educates and awakens the imaginations of our youth.Our theatre lab provides a form of experimentations by professional, the development of new performance material, and the rediscovery of classics.The lab enables artists to explore new work and new ways of working- inorder to forge a deeper connection between actor and audience,self and community. Stage Indias artists are encouraged to move theatre forward- to transform deepen and clarify new ways of working. we create professional quality theatre for a vibrant and diverse population.We encourage and improve artistic growth in the community by producing a broad reportoire theatre,giving local theatre artists creative oppertunities and offering educational theatre and outreach programmes. we are commited to creating, teaching and learning about theatre that enlightens as well as entertains, that explores the values and ideas of many cultures and earas,and that contributes the artistic and personal groth of both participents and audience.We work to create a learning environment that is a model for the collaborative work of theatre and life.We draw upon the talent of the actors ,directors, writers and designers from around the country who are shapping the Indian Theatre scene.Stage India also offers a wide variety of educational ,community and litterary programmes design to enrich and deepen theatre knoledge.

detailsOfAchievement: State Resource Centre, Kerala is an autonomous organization instituted by the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India under the management and supervision of General Education Department, Government of Kerala. The objective of SRC, Kerala is to provide academic and technical resource support for comprehensive and sustainable non-formal/ adult/ continuing/lifelong and community education. SRC, Kerala is unique in nature by dealing wide range of beneficiaries such as illiterate to highly educated, poor to rich, marginalized to mainstream. SRC has been synchronizing educational components, technical skill and manpower for a better and sustainable human resource development. Major Acivements 1. Received NLM-UNESCO Award in 2003 for its outstanding contributions in the field of Literacy & Continuing Education Programme. 2. Management Development Institute (MDI), Gurgaon evaluated SRC, Kerala and graded A* for the outstanding performance of SRC. 3. National level award received for the conduct of best research study. 4. SRC evaluated several projects like Environmental Literacy Programme (ENLITE) of Attappady Hills Area Development Society (AHADS) and the Total Primary Education Programme (TPEP) by the Kannur District. 5. Several feasibility studies were conducted on behalf of the Directorate of Adult education, Government of India for setting up of JSS in Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh. 6. Produced more than 1000 titles of print materials. 7. Produced 150 titles of non-print materials. 8. Resource support to Comprehensive Braille Literacy Programme of Malappuram district. 9. Resource support to Environment Literacy Programme (ENLITE) of AHADS. 10. Comprehensive Adolescence Education Campaign at Thaliparambu block in Kannur District 11. Extended resource support for the development of a Bridge Primer in Kurumba, Muduga and Irula language for the tribal community in Attapadi Area of Palakkadu district. 12. Successfully organized 100 pre-marital counseling camps all over Kerala. 13. Publishing monthly magazine for Resource Persons and beneficiaries. 14. Conducted and published more than 100 Research studies on various topics and issues. 15. Highly qualified and committed staff. 16. Housed at own building situated at Nandavanam in Thiruvananathapurm. 17. Coordination with a good number of GOs and NGOs for joint action and for implementing various programme. 18. Project and programme management is one vital area under operation. 19. Providing resource support to NGOs for developing and implementing development education projects. 20. Wide net work with national and international agencies. 21. Running a Community College in collaboration with Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU), New Delhi. 22. Experience in designing curriculum for vocational training and other skill development programmes. 23. Resource support for the establishment of Lakshadweep Literacy Mission Authority (LLMA) and for running Continuing Education Programme of Lakshadweep. 24. Resource support to Total Literacy Programmes in Ezhome Village (Kannur), Kottayam municipality, Ernakualam district and entire state of Kerala. 25. Developed an Open Distance and Flexible Learning Programme on Community Development in collaboration with Commonwealth of Learning, Canada for the Community Development Workers such as; Preraks, ASHA Workers, Anganvadi Workers, Kudumbasree Workers, Tribal Promoters, NGO Workers and Aspirant Social Workers.

detailsOfAchievement: Streechetana. a womens forum started in 2006 in Kozhikode with a handful of women, has now become a visible force and has made significant impact on the society with its noble vision and dedicated mission. Our vision is to uphold, cherish and safeguard the rights and dignity of women by focusing on empowerment and self development. Our activities are mainly centered round three sectors women, children and the community. We conduct regular awareness programmes for disseminating knowledge on important issues concerning women like gender mainstreaming, domestic violence,Leagal awareness, immoral trafficking etc with the help of experts. We have coordinated vocational training programmes in collaboration with other agencies. We have also conducted workshops on entrepreneurship development like mushroom cultivation, tailoring, paper bag making, jewellery making. Many of our trainees have started their own units. For the youth, in the field of education, we conduct programmes for adolescents for teaching life skills to enable them to become better adults and responsible citizens. We have already conducted Niravu a life skill programme for 3 years in a local Govt school for 120 girls with very satisfying results. In addition, we have a scholarship programme NILA for needy female students to provide financial support to deserving persons. At community level, we have undertaken distribution of sanitary kits, and notebooks on regular basis to people from underprivileged sections. We have championed the cause of underprivileged by getting them drinking water and freedom from water logging after filing PIL and a long legal battle. Streechetana initiative resulted in many positive changes in the issue of Womens toilets in the city. The Honorable Ombudsman ordered the following within 13 sittings with the Petitioner Streechetana and the officials of the Corporation.15 automatic toilets were constructed in the city. Toilets complexes constructed in Sarovaram Bio Park and Beach. All our achievements are well documented with photographs on our website www.streechetana.in and has also been covered adequately by the local media.

detailsOfAchievement: Vimala Community Extension Centre Achievements Vimala Community extension Centre was established in the year 1976 with the objectives of providing opportunities for students it realize important social problems, intervening in areas like women and children welfare through various programmes to fulfill this mandate ,the centre has been providing various services including vocational training, providing hostel facilities to girl students and women ,counselling services sponsorship programmes and addressing the problems of children in need of care and protection. The present programmes of the centre include CHILDLINE nodal organization supported by ministry of Women and Child development, family Counselling Centre supported by Central Social welfare Board,service Providing Centre For DV Act2005 and children Sponsorship programme funded by the college and Corporate agencies. Vimala Family Counselling Centre was established in 1998 December .In the last year from April to March 2016 The family Counselling Centre provided counselling in632 cases, In addition to this ,counsellors conduct awareness programmes ,seminars, sub committee meetings regularly. Cases are referred to psychologist and assistance of legal adviser also provided in issues of domestic violence. CHILDLINE Nodal organization was started in 2002.Since then; the organisation has been intervening in child rights issues in the district. As the nodal organization, we could conduct training programmes for various allied systems like police, education.health .district administration, Panchyathi raj institution etc. advocacy initiatives, networking and research activities. The centre supports 100 school children in the nearby communities for their studies. They are given financial support; counselling and mentoring services and awareness programmes on a regular basis. Service Providing Centre for DV Act2005 provides legal assistance to survivors of domestic violence free of cost.

detailsOfAchievement: The aim of the society is to ensure the handicrafts artisans and to provide help and assistance to improve the financial positions of those who work in handicrafts sector. In addition to promote the traditional jobs, literacy of rural peoples, financial growth of the community, social & cultural activities, arts & sports activities, provide job opportunity etc. And conducting skill development training for unemployed youth. We are conducting sales melas, exhibitions, craft bazars etc. Through our society functioning consumers stores (sales with 15-70% discount rate). The society implemented loan facilities at lowest interest rate and simple formalities. Under the society functioning one of the CFSC. We are implementing so many welfare schemes like group insurance, health insurance, pension scheme, free medical camp, awareness programme, teenage education, various skill development trainings, design and technical development workshop, ornaments making, manufacturing of paper bags training etc. The society collecting deposits from the community with full security and reasonable interest according to the instruction of co operative registrar. we are implementing savings deposit schemes, fixed deposit schemes, monthly deposit schemes etc. In the past 10 years more than 8000 artisans newly joint in the handicrafts sector in various crafts. The majority of the artisans are women and become OBC & SC/ST category. And we can promote the education of the backward community children. The economical and social development can be improved in the society.

detailsOfAchievement: The organization is engaged in the proposed sector for the last 13 years and has sufficient infrastructural facilities of Land, Building, Machineries, Tools, and Skill Trainers etc. Above all, many of the targeted beneficiaries groups of Rural BPL & Women headed families are approaching us to provide them skill training in coconut value added products. Due to lack of funds, we could not implement. Now, we believe we can utilize the support of STEP scheme and we believe that our organization is competent to undertake this project. The traditional coconut workers lost their jobs due to the advancement of oil extracting machineries and many of the women became jobless. We think, we can rehabilitate them through STEP Scheme. The training component included in this course is an integrated approach of multiple products, which never undertaken by any other agencies. We are confident that after completion of this training program, the beneficiaries can start self-employment / Entrepreneurship. Our organization provides necessary support to achieve the aims and objectives.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The society has received an amount of Rs.5,38,200/- towards the scheme of Training and Employment Programme for Women under Ministry of Women and Child Development and the same has been utilized in full and Utilization Certificate has been issued.
